alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Perry; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 7:50PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Greene, Hale, Perry and Sumter. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 750 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Demopolis, Livingston, Forkland, Newbern, Arcola, Duffys Bend, Thornhill, Tishabee, Dug Hill, Bluffport, Birdine, Belmont, McDowell and Cedarville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
